meanings.definition: The back part of the foot below the ankle.
meanings.sent1: She felt pain in her heels after standing all day.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's heels lifted gracefully as she performed.
meanings.sent3: He tried to scratch his itchy heel discreetly during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The heels of the loafers were worn down from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The runner's heels hit the pavement rhythmically with each step.

meanings.definition: The part of a shoe or boot supporting the heel.
meanings.sent1: The high heels of her shoes clicked on the marble floor.
meanings.sent2: He checked the quality of the shoe heels before buying them.
meanings.sent3: The kitten playfully attacked the dangling heel of the shoe.
meanings.sent4: The heels of his boots left imprints in the soft mud.
meanings.sent5: She admired the intricate design on the heels of the boots.

meanings.definition: To lean back on the heels.
meanings.sent1: She heels back in her chair while listening intently.
meanings.sent2: Heels against the wall, she balanced on her tiptoes.
meanings.sent3: The cat heels lazily against the warm radiator.
meanings.sent4: He heels back in surprise as the door suddenly slams shut.
meanings.sent5: The tree heels back in the wind, its branches swaying.

meanings.sent1: The detective heels the suspect through the crowded market.
meanings.sent2: The loyal dog heels its owner wherever she goes.
meanings.sent3: The curious child heels the teacher around the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The shadow heels him silently as he walks down the dimly lit street.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter heels him wherever he goes.
